name: cfinclude
description: Includes the content from the referenced file (template). The content may be executed as CFML, see compatibility info. You can embed cfinclude tags recursively. For another way to encapsulate CFML, see cfmodule. (A CFML page was formerly sometimes called a CFML template or a template.)

params.name: template
params.description: A logical path to a CFML page.

params.name: runOnce
params.description: If set to true, the given template (if already processed) is not processed again for a given request. CF10+

coldfusion.notes: The script syntax: include, was added in CF9. CF11 changed behaviour such that only files with the extension cfm or cfml are compiled and executed by cfinclude (configurable in Application.cfc via this.compileextforinclude), all other files will be statically included.
